item.title: The Red Violin: Timeless Memory
item.description: Blocktag wants to amplify this timeless appreciation for art. The violin's stories will be remembered through Blocktag's authentication tagâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
The Red Violin

Have you wondered why someone would spend millions on antique art? A movie The Red Violin has an answer. The movie's main character is a red violin, filmed from the violinâ€™s point of view. From its birth in Cremona Italy during the 1700s. To its ownership by an English lord in Britain during the 1800s Victorian royal era. Then, its near destruction in Shanghai during the 1900s Cultural Revolution. And eventually, its auction for millions in modern day Montreal. The Red Violin is based on the real life violin of 1720 called the Red Mendelssohn, which sold for $1.7million in 1990

Timeless Art Appreciation

As an art appreciation, the violin lets you hear and touch memories of the past. The violin plays a string of past life memories shared with its human owners.

Blocktag wants to amplify this timeless appreciation for art. The violin's stories will be remembered through Blocktag's authentication tag. Scan the Blocktagged violin with your phone camera and you can watch a real life version of "The Red Violin".

The shared memory could be a digitized certificate of authenticity issued by the original violin maker as well as stories of the owner, appraiser, restorer and other professionals that have taken care of the violin.

Or a performance recording by a musician with the violin. Like this 2020AD pandemic era shared memory with a masked performer.

Blocktag Timeless Art Appreciation

Blocktag is partnering with a violinist to let people appreciate this timeless form of art. Her violin is crafted by a violin maker (Luthier) and featured by the Associazione Liutaria Italiana in Cremona Italy, the world capital for handcrafted violins. If you buy the 3D scanned Digital Twin of this physical tagged violin on the OpenSea marketplace, you can access all of the violin's recorded memories: https://opensea.io/collection/blocktag-violin-nft

PS: Safeguard Memory With Non Fungible Token (NFT)

To safeguard the violin's recorded digital memory from tampering, a violin's story recorded through Blocktag is unchangeable (non fungible). When this unchangeable unit (token) of data is stored on a digital ledger, it is known as a Non Fungible Token (NFT). Combining the tagged physical violin and its digital data forms a physical NFT. Read more at https://www.blocktag.com/blog/violin-physical-nft/

ChunMing Chin
Cofounder, Director of Engineering
Blocktag Inc

item.title: Violin Digital Twin
item.description: A violinist has partnered with Blocktag to auction an authenticated, 3D scan model of her phyiscal violin on OpenSea https://opensea.ioâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
A violinist has partnered with Blocktag to auction an authenticated, 3D scan model of her phyiscal violin on OpenSea https://opensea.io/collection/blocktag-violin-nft. You might be thinking: "Is there value in buying a digital twin instead of the physical violin?".

Traditionally, experts authenticate violins by checking visual characteristics like the violin's varnish, wood grain pattern etc. Blocktag wants to resonate with this tradition by using the digital twin as the physical violin's 3D fingerprint.

Violin Authentication Evolution

For basic authentication, the original violin's tag has a unique chaotic print signature that is recorded by the Blocktag camera app as a fingerprint.

For advanced authentication, the original violin's visual properties near the tag e.g. Wood grain pattern, texture, shape etc. is recorded by the Blocktag camera app as a fingerprint.

For expert authentication, the entire original violin outside and inside can be 3D scanned as a digital twin fingerprint.

Augmented Reality Authentication

To authenticate if a physical violin matches with its expected 3D digital twin fingerprint, Blocktag guides users to navigate their camera around the violin with Augmentated Reality (AR).

Tranform Piracy To Promotion

The digital twin's varnish looks different from the physical violin as it is encrypted by Blocktag to prevent public access to the actual fingerprint. Only the owner can access the fingerprint by verifying they own the digital twin's Non Fungible Token (NFT) in their digital wallet. This security design transforms the threat of digital twin piracy into an opportunity. Pirates are welcome to freely copy the public digital twin to promote vintage violin art!

The Purest Representation

The digital twin is the purest visual representation of the original violin. As "The Red Violin" movie shows, it is unavoidable that an antique violin is damaged over time. Once damaged, restoration with new parts does not look like the original violin. To preserve archives of the original violin, the tagged physical violin is 3D scanned.

ChunMing Chin
Cofounder, Director of Engineering
Blocktag Inc

item.title: Long Live Violin
item.description: What is the origin of an instrumentâ€™s life? From the growth of its Maple tree material? From the violin maker crafting its form? From theâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
What is the origin of an instrumentâ€™s life?
From the growth of its Maple tree material?
From the violin maker crafting its form?
From the musician giving its voice?

The violin remembers all emotional vibrations. The conscious back and forth bow movement, even the unconscious shaking hands during my first concert. The sounds of String vibration and Newtonian motion are carved into it's wood. The violinâ€™s inner Space remembers all forms of vibrations in its Time.

People believe they are the lead soloist in their lifeâ€™s symphony. But in the universeâ€™s vast expanse of space and time, we are a fleeting spark. The violin lives longer than me. It should remember its own stories as the lead performer. I am just a partner playing a supporting role.

In the 16th century, Cremona Italy was the world capital of handcrafted violins. Each violin has its own printed â€œCertificato Di Authenticaâ€. The violinâ€™s unique fingerprint identity.

In the 21st century, Blocktag is a printed tag authentication technology. Each tag has its own unclonable fingerprint. When a violin is tagged, you can scan the tag with your phone camera and see the violinâ€™s past life and its history for the centuries to come.

As time goes by, the violinâ€™s life story can be recorded. For example, a partner musicianâ€™s performance recording at a concert hall. Generations of performers all the way back to the violin maker can be remembered this way.

https://app.blocktag.com/CNPFjZEG
This is the webpage linked to the tag inside my violin. The digital violin is the a 3D scan of the real violin, its digital twin. Blocktag is the eternal memory body of the violin.

The maker crafts it's form. The musician gives it life. Witness the evolution of each human generation.
